subsc: Ports, waterways and shipping,Irrigation and drainage,Sub-national government administration,Central government administration,Roads and highways
trustfund:
TF035447-LAC REGION - WASTE WATER
            MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (ST. VINCENT,,TF033419-BELIZE - PUBLIC EXPENDITURE REVIEW

abstracts.cdata!:
The project seeks to:  (a) improve
            health and safety of Belize City dwellers; (b) preserve the
            rich ecology of the city and its environs, one of the most
            important assets of the country; (c) promote economic
            development of the city, in particular provide a boost to
            tourism, the fastest growing industry in the country; and
            (d) strengthen city capacity for infrastructure maintenance
            and delivery of urban services.  The project provides for:
            (a) rehabilitation of street network and traffic management;
            (b) improvement of the drainage system including canals and
            creeks; (c) coastal protection and berth facilities; and (d)
            strengthening the city's capacity to maintain its
            infrastructure and improve the delivery of urban services.
